title: Indonesian, Sri Lankan Police officers honoured for arrest of Kehelbaddara Padme and group
byline: Indonesian police officers who played a key role in the arrest of underworld figure Kehelbaddara Padme and four other Sri Lankan organised criminals were felicitated and presented with awards at the Bandaranaike International Airport.

title: One killed, another injured in shooting near Wennappuwa Police Station
byline: A shooting incident this morning on Wewa Road, near the Wennappuwa Police Station, left one person dead and another injured.

title: Excise officers impersonating Narcotics Bureau arrested for bribery
byline: Three officers from the Chankanai Excise Office were arrested by the Northern Provincial Crime Division for allegedly attempting to obtain a Rs. 2 million bribe while posing as officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau.

title: Unauthorized settlers occupy half of Kandy hospital land
byline: Nearly half of the land belonging to the Kandy National Hospital has been encroached upon by unauthorized settlers, posing a serious obstacle to the hospital’s development, Director Dr. Iresha Fernando revealed.

title: Public Security Ministry denies fake photos of Minister at airport
byline: The Public Security Ministry has denied social media claims showing Minister Ananda Wijeyapala worshiping at the airport after the arrival of underworld figures arrested in Indonesia.

title: CID to record statements from Gotabaya Rajapaksa and Saman Ekanayake
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and former Presidential Secretary Saman Ekanayake are reportedly summoned to the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) to record  statements in connection with two separate investigations.

title: India’s Modi meets Xi on his first China trip in seven years as Trump’s tariffs bite
byline: A much-anticipated meeting of the leaders of the world’s two most populous nations is underway, with China’s Xi Jinping welcoming India’s Narendra Modi on the sidelines of regional summit in Tianjin – as the neighbors explore a rapprochement accelerated by their shared frictions with the US.

title: Sri Lankans to witness rare ‘Blood Moon’ on September 7
byline: Sri Lankans will have the rare chance to witness a spectacular ’Blood Moon’ next month, Prof. Chandana Jayaratne, Head of the Department of Physics at the University of Colombo and Chairman of the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies, said.

title: Absurd to celebrate arrest of underworld figures: Dolawatte
byline: Exposing the identity of police officers who conducted investigations into the underworld figures who were arrested in Indonesia poses a great risk to their families, former SLPP MP Premanath C. Dolawatte said.

title: Sri Lanka fined for slow over-rate in Harare ODI
byline: Sri Lanka were penalised five per cent of their match fees for maintaining a slow over-rate in the first ODI in Harare.
